div.p: SINISTER, ſomething on or towards the left hand. Hence ſome derive the word sinist er, a sinendo ; becauſe the gods, by ſuch auguries, permit us to proceed in our deſigns.

Sinister, is ordinarily uſed among us for unlucky ; though, in the ſacred rites of divination, the Romans uſed it in an oppoſite ſenſe. Thus avis sinistra, or a bird on the left hand, was eſteemed a happy omen : whence,
in the law of the 12 tables, Ave sinistra populi magister esto.
Sinister, in heraldry. The ſiniſter side of an eſcutcheon is the left-hand side ; the ſiniſter chief, the left angle of the chief ; the ſiniſter baſe, the left-hand part of the baſe.
Sinister Aspect, among aſtrologers, is an appearance of two planets happening according to the ſucceſſion of the ſigns ; as Saturn in Aries, and Mars in the ſame degree of gemini.
